page.title: 04SALTERHEBBLE SEWAGE DISPOSAL
page.content: Salterhebble sewage works treats waste products derived from home and industry. On average 50 gallons of water per day per person are treated at the works serving 97000 people. A similar abount comes from textile, brewing and confectionary factories. In dry weather the volume received is about 10 million gallons and ten times that in wet. The first attempt to treat sewage was in 1899, later developments in 1911, 1929,1939 and 1967. The main sewer system is operated by gravity and sewage from Elland and West Vale is pumped to Salterhebble. Following three stages of treatment water is pumped to the River Calder and sludge is tipped at Lowfields, Elland.
